_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Ashland Distribution Company (Ashland) relies on numerous programs to ensure early idnetificaiton of and proper response to potential emergencies, including:

Training and drills in emergency prepararedness, hazardous materials training, disaster resposne and   control, first aid, and fire-and-rescue techniques;

Frequesnt auditing of all preparedness programs, safety training and education; and

Regular review, followupo, and maintenance of all company operations and equipment.

Our facilties invite local fire departments and emergecny resposnders to tour and inpsect our plants, particiapte in joint emergency drills, and gain familiarity with our operations.  Many of our employees are memjebers of the Local Emergency Planning Commission in their areas.  Our facilities have written emergecny preparedness plans that are updated regularly.

Ashland facilities typically host open houses every three to five years as an opportunity for neighbors to learn about outr commitment to safety.  Ashland makes an effort to support our communities thorugh sponsorship of local activities and participation in many local organizations.

A description of your facility and the regulated substances handled:

Ashland's Garland, TX facility is a chemical distribution warehouse.  The regulated substnace arrive at the warehouse loading dock, are transferred to storge and subsequently loaded for shipment without ever opening the containers.  The regulated substance is 30% solution of ammonia with water.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical specific  prevetnions steps:

The Garland, TX distribution warehouse is operated in strict accordance with the USEPA prevetnion program requirements.  A written management system is in place along with written operating procedures.  Our management system procedures ensure rigorous training for operations employees, numerous management checks and balances and strict attention to changes in the operations with athorough review and

examnination of potnetial incidnets that could lead to an accidental release.  Ashland maintains a 24 hour corporate emergency reporting system that can speedily coordinate emergency resposne with management and quickly communicate key first aid or medical information to local health care providers.  This facility has emergency medical treatment information readily available for use in an emergency.

Five year accident history:

We have not handled 30% ammonia solution at the Garland, TX facility, however we have not had a significant release of hazardous materials at this location within the last five years.

Emergency Resposne Program:

The employees of the Garland, TX facility distribution warehouse do not respond offensively to accidnetal relaease of the regulated substnaces, but rley on local emergency responders when there is a need.  Our employees regularly undergo training in defensive emergency response activities.  Our facility regularly invites the local fire department and emergency responders to tour and inspect our plant and gain familiarity with our operations.  This facility has a written emergecny preparedness plan this updated regularly.

Planned changes to improve safety:

The Garland, TX distribution warehouse continually evaluates and implements employee suggestions and recommendations resulting from routine hazard reviews. We make changes to improve safety based on comments and information developed within our organization and the industry.  Toward continuous improvement, we are looking at ways to minimize risk through process improvement and re-design.  Ashland is committed to the American Chemistry Council's Responsible Care SM Initiative Management Codes on Process Safety.
